thread.title: EPIC FAIL: Alec Baldwin Attempts To Mock Trump, Fails Miserably
thread.title_full: EPIC FAIL: Alec Baldwin Attempts To Mock Trump, Fails Miserably

author: Katie Jerkovich
title: EPIC FAIL: Alec Baldwin Attempts To Mock Trump, Fails Miserably
text:
TOP MADRID, SPAIN - OCTOBER 02: Alec Baldwin attends "El Hormiguero" TV show at Vertice Studio on October 2, 2014 in Madrid, Spain. (Photo by Juan Naharro Gimenez/Getty Images) 5410905 
Alec Baldwin attempted to mock President-elect Donald Trump’s slogan, Make America Great Again, but failed miserably. 
On Friday, the 58-year-old actor shared a photo on Instagram with his 190,000 followers. In the shot he was wearing a red ball cap with Russian lettering that was supposed to say “Make America Great Again,” implying that Russia had something to do with Trump winning the election. (RELATED: Alec Baldwin: ‘I Don’t Hate Donald Trump’) (photo: REUTERS/Carlo Allegri/Files) A photo posted by Alec Baldwin (@iamabfalecbaldwin) on Jan 6, 2017 at 8:26am PST 
After the Fox News contributor spotted an article about the photo on Saturday she messaged the actor via Twitter about his mistake. 
“Sigh, Alec Baldwin… that hat is both grammatically incorrect and is more about making America groovy again,” Roginsky tweeted. 
Sigh, Alec Baldwin… that hat is both grammatically incorrect and is more about making America groovy again. https://t.co/86xmaX6HAA 
— Julie Roginsky (@julieroginsky) January 8, 2017 
When she was asked about what the hat actually translated to she responded that the words were “all wrong.” 
“The grammatical declensions of the words are all wrong and the word for ‘great’ is better translated as ‘awesome’ or ‘groovy,'” Roginsky tweeted. The grammatical declensions of the words are all wrong and the word for “great” is better translated as “awesome” or “groovy.” https://t.co/0cYQ7wDwFt
